intro: Umbilicus sessilis, commonly known as the sessile umbilic, is a small, flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its simple, basal leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
